result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon Jacque Mckenna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today April 6, 2016.
Court grants expungement upon successful completion of Probation and initiated by Defendant.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file, balance to be paid within 60 days.
DNA surcharge.

-Anger Management Assessment and complete all follow through.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Complete any other programming per COMPAS Assessment or Agent.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Fox, ADA: Alexis McKinley, DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber, DF:  Dillon Jacque Mckenna appeared. Case called at 3:02 pm. State recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT domestic abuse enhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Dom abuse enhancer stricken. Victim statement. Sentencing arguments.
Crt orders: S/W 1 year probation with conditions: 
- Anger management assessment and complete all follow through.  
- $243.00 in court costs payable through Clerk of Court
- $200.00 DNA sample and surcharge - Payable through Clerk of Court.
- Complete any other programming per COMPASS or Probation recommendations. 
Defendant to report to probation today. 
Apply bond on file and mail 60 DTP for remainder of amount owing.

Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation and initiated by def.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 12-23-2015 10:00 am

Bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Traci L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly        Dillon Jacque Mckenna pro se.

CO:  RMW, (Reporter) Val Deiss, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF:  Dillon Jacque Mckenna did not appear. Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance at 12-03-2015 01:00 pm
